* Email: councilwomanrflores@yahoo.com

The City of McGregor is a home rule city operating under a council/manager form of government. The City Council is comprised of the Mayor and five Council members. The Mayor and one council member are elected at-large, and the remaining council members are elected by ward, with all serving two-year terms. The Mayor Pro-Tem is selected by the City Council from among the council members. The City Council is responsible for adopting the annual budget, appointing committees, hiring the City Attorney, City Manager, City Secretary and Municipal Court Judge, as well as enacting ordinances and establishing the tax rate.

### **Correspondence to the Mayor and/or the City Council may be sent to:**

City Hall

Attn: Angelia Sloan, City Secretary

Physical Address: 302 S. Madison; McGregor, TX 76657

Mailing Address: P.O. Box 192; McGregor, TX 76657

ASloan@McGregor-Texas.com

### **Council Meetings are open to the public.**

City Council Meetings are normally held on the second Monday of every month at 6:30 p.m. at City Hall in the Council Chambers, 302 S. Madison St. (North Entrance). Meetings are open to the public, with an agenda posted on the outside bulletin board at City Hall (North Entrance) and on this website by the Friday preceding the meeting  (click [HERE](https://cityofmcgregor.com/city-government/agenda/) to see the City Council agendas).

### **Addressing the Council:**

Those interested in addressing the Council may do so at any Council meeting by signing in prior to the opening of the meeting. The sign-in log is located on the right side of the Council Dais.  In order to afford everyone an equal opportunity to address the Council, speakers are asked to limit their presentations to three minutes during the public comment section as posted on the agenda and/or on any agenda item.   Council is unable to take action, but will listen. The Council is prohibited from responding to comments or asking questions, but may ask staff to look into concerns and provide follow-up.

If you plan to present Council with information, have the materials  ready to present to the City Secretary who will distribute to the Council.  Any information you would like to provide to the Council prior to the meeting may be emailed to the City Secretary at [asloan@mcgregor-texas.com](mailto:asloan@mcgregor-texas.com) no later than Tuesday prior to the following Monday’s meeting.

To be placed on the agenda to more formally address the Council, notification should be made no later than the Tuesday prior to the following Monday’s meeting. A written request is required, stating the reason for the appointment and topic to be addressed and this will be placed on the agenda at the discretion of the City Manager and Mayor.

### [June 5, 2021 Q&A with Mayor Hering at Amsler Park](https://cityofmcgregor.com/wp-content/uploads/Q-and-A-from-Amsler-meeting-6.10.21-.2.pdf)

### **Elections:**

General City Elections are held in May of each year. For more information on how to run for office, please contact the City Secretary’s office at (254) 840-2806 or visit www.sos.state.tx.us.

**Candidate Eligibility Requirements:**

* must be a United States Citizen
* must be 18 years of age
* have not been determined by final judgment of a court exercising probate jurisdiction to be mentally incapacitated; or partially mentally incapacitated without the right to vote
* have not been finally convicted of a felony from which the person has not been pardoned or otherwise released from the resulting disabilities
* have resided continuously in the City of McGregor for at least twelve (12) months
* must have resided within the Ward from which they seek election for at least six (6) months immediately preceding the date appointment is made
* must be a qualified voter of the State of Texas

**The City contracts with the Election Night Results will be posted on the McLennan County Elections website at [www.mclennanvotes.com](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.mclennanvotes.com%2F&data=04%7C01%7Ctheexchange%40mcgregor-texas.com%7Cf6995b6307b047b56cf708d87aa35789%7C0799af768bf64b0da50cbd04a82e22be%7C0%7C0%7C637394189263260957%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=sEoqMQNnfrXREOK3xjD7d674lnzgqrKdg2aHHoAibZc%3D&reserved=0)** **under current election results or <https://www.co.mclennan.tx.us/546/Current-Election-Results>****.  Early Voting will be posted between 7:00 pm and 8:00 pm.  The Election Day results will be posted after that as the boxes are returned to the Elections Office, approximately one hour per update.  There will be a list of the Vote Centers Reporting with each Election Day report posted.**

NOTICE OF ADOPTED 2025 TAX RATE:

 

City of McGregor ADOPTED A TAX RATE THAT WILL RAISE MORE TAXES FOR MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS THAN LAST YEAR’S TAX RATE.

THE TAX RATE WILL EFFECTIVELY BE RAISED BY 3.50 PERCENT AND WILL RAISE TAXES FOR  
MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS ON A $100,000 HOME BY APPROXIMATELY $11.48.
